JustineCredible

5:00a.m. - Wake up
 5:15a.m. - Start coffee
 5:30a.m. - shower
 5:45a.m. - Wake my son
 6:00a.m. - discuss after school events, make sure my son has all his homework packed and his lunch money.
 6:15a.m. - watch the Weather Channel with my son
 6:30a.m. - Shoo son out the door so he can meet his school bus.
 6:45a.m. - Breath a sigh of relief that he hasn't returned saying he missed the bus.
 7:00a.m. - Check email
 7:30a.m. - take a short 1hr nap
 8:30a.m. - rise again to make sure my partner has everything for her day at work.
 8:45a.m. - answer phone, partner has inevidably left something or forgotten to tell me something as she walked out the door.
 9:00a.m. - Check other email for orders from clients, print out orders, check against list of projects, enter orders into temporary invoice spreadsheet program.
 10:00a.m. - Re-organize sewing room and check progress of current projects.
 11:00a.m. - attack projects that are nearly finished.
 12:00 (noon) - meet new client for lunch
 1:30p.m. - shop for more trims, gimps, leather pieces, jewelery findings (if needed) and fabric.(or go online to blow off steam because you really just don't want to look at that darned jaquard fabric right now)
 3:00p.m. - get home just in time to meet my son as he's coming home from school and discuss his day while I put away/organized my materials.
 3:30p.m. - design new paterns for new client projects
 4:00p.m. - curse the day you ever picked up a sewing needle
 4:02p.m. - call client and ask for missing measurements
 (usually leaving a message on their voicemail.)
 4:10p.m. Go back to projects which need attention
 4:40p.m. - answer phone and get proper measurements from client
 5:00p.m. - restart new patern.
 5:30p.m. - chalk out patern on fabric
 5:45p.m. - toss scissors at wall as they have inevitably gone dull from the last time you had to cut four layers of brocade at once.
 6:00p.m. - After either sharpening scissors or finding the pair you actually like, restart cutting out the pieces of whatever kirttle, chemise, trousers, jacket...etc new client has ordered.
 6:40p.m. - relize partner will be home in about 15mins and start diner
 7:00p.m - while stiring the mushrooms, toss catnip bag at son so he can sprinkle some for the cats which are clammering at your feet.
 7:05p.m. - Greet partner and let her know when dinner "Should" be ready.
 7:30p.m. - drape and pin fabric pieces on dressform
 7:45p.m. - sit down with family for dinner, which may or may not be burned.
 8:15p.m. - discuss schedules with partner and son. Since at least one of your projects is probably a new costume piece for her that she needed a week ago, and your son has a football game on the day you both have to leave for another state for a Renaissance related event, probably one he is either performing in or you are directing or both.
 9:00p.m. - Re-pin fabric pieces to dressform as undoubtedly they have fallen off or been pulled off by cats!
 9:15p.m. - sit at sewing table and throw imaginary brick at your machine because the bulb blew out.
 9:17p.m. - replace bulb.
 9:20p.m. - begin new project, usually at the top...hehehe
 11:00p.m. - go online because if you have to stare at that brocade a minute longer you will go blind.
 12:30a.m. - concider going back to sewing room
 12:45a.m. - actually make it back in there and complete lining of whatever piece you had started
 1:30a.m. - Promice yourself you will go to bed eventually
 2:00a.m. - after choosing trims you finally decide that maybe you're a bit blurry-eyed and Goose-turd green gimp just might not look all that great on a Periwinkle kirttle.
 2:15a.m. head hits pillow, but you actually fell asleep five minutes before hand.
 
 There you have it. That's my typical day. 
 Not a lot of time for sleep let alone "devient sexual behaviors."
 
 My non-typical days don't leave a whole lot of time for such things either.
 
 Kinda sounds like just about anyother stay-at-home/work-from-home mom doesn't it?

 What about week-ends? :)
JustineCredible

What about week-ends? :)

 
 I am usually out of town. This weekend being an exception, but my partner is out of town.
 My son and I are performers and I am a director as well, for area Reniassance festivals and events. 
 I'm either teaching Renaissance period dance or holding Period Costuming classes. My son is an accomplished musician with these events/faires. He plays several instruments and is one heck of a great "stool ball" player. (Stool ball is the predisesor to modern Cricket...comprised of two teams with only two players on each teams playing field.... such tournaments can last two days as the scoring goes up to 60 for tournament games.)
 
 I also do 'behind the scenes' work for my partner's Civil War Medical education team. (headed by her uncle) I do seamstress work for that period style as well as repairs on tents, cots, chairs or anything of fabric. I also am the sign maker for this group. (Mostly because I'm the one who owns the woodburning kit!) 
 
 I'm fairly busy all the time. Just like any other 'thiry-something', suburban mom, my partner and I actually have to "schedule" alone time. But that's just how things go. Not all that titalating I'm afraid.
Duo_Maxwell

The Gay Agenda
 
 it has a good representation of gay life at the end. Try not to laugh too hard.

Hi Justine:
 
 
You wrote << 5:00a.m. - Wake up, 5:15a.m. - Start coffee, 5:30a.m. - shower, 5:45a.m. - Wake my son . . .

 
 1. I am very curious over whether (in your mind) your son is heterosexual male or homosexual male? 
 
 2. Then, I am wondering if you are a heterosexual female or a homosexual female?

 I am not interested in your fanatical views.
JustineCredible

Hi Justine:
 
 
 
 1. I am very curious over whether (in your mind) your son is heterosexual male or homosexual male? 

 
 My son's sexual orientation is NOT   up for discussion. 
 
 
2. Then, I am wondering if you are a heterosexual female or a homosexual female?

 
 Please refer to my other posts. You will find the answer to this in previous threads. 
 
 
3. Then, was the father of your son a heterosexual male, or a homosexual male?

 
 What does the sexual orientation of my son's father have to do with anything? If you had bothered to actually read my previous posts in other threads you wouldn't have to ask these inane questions. 
 
 
4. And lastly, is your current girlfriend a heterosexual female, or a homosexual female?

 
 Just so there's no misunderstanding: 
 
 DUH   
 
 Granted, I realize that my comment there was most obviously sophomoric, but I just have a real problem with those who refuse to read. 
 It's fairly obvious that Terral03 has not read anything I have posted in any other thread. They were completely unnecessary and a blatent attempt to draw me into a conversation/attack/argument which would be wholey one sided.

 GL,
 
 Terral

 I'm more that a "big girl" darlin, I'm a mother. I'm not your daughter, I'm not a bible student, I'm an adult woman. Until you stop with your degrading remarks to me or anyone else, your motives will always be suspect.
 
 
 Perhaps she does not care to answer, because you might not like her reply.

 
 Who exactly might not like my replies? 
 Terral, I did answer your questions. Maybe not with the answers you wanted to hear, but those are my answers.
 
 
 How is it that Gay folks seem ready, willing and able to talk about their sexuality to complete strangers in these threads without reservation. Then, when someone comes along and asks them about it, they clam up and complain about attacks and arguments that simply do not exist?

 
 Did I complain? No
 Did I accuse you of attacking me? No
 
 What I did do was question your intent. I also asked as to your interest in my personal/private life. Insted of answering my fairly straight foreward questions you are the one who is complaining and accusing me of attacking you. 
 That is a lie. You know it and it's fairly obvious to anyone else who can read. 
 Yes, I asked my questions to you numerous times. But not without a valid concern. You had repeatedly ignored my posts on this thread  . 
 
 Note, I said "THIS THREAD", I am not speaking of other threads here. Just one.
 It would be appreciated if for once you could actually stick to the subject at hand within the appropriate thread. 
 
 
If her reply were as simple as you suggest, then she would have simply said so.

 
 Actually I did say so. I answered your questions. Now the ball is in your court and you are continuing to ignore my questions by your devisive changing of subject.
 
 
 No sir. This onion has many layers, and this is about much more than refusing to answer four very simple questions. 
 
 Terral

 
 Well then, we are all waiting with baited breath for you to reveal those layers. 
 Anytime you are ready to actually stick to the subject and answer my questions as I have asked them, I will be more than happy to respond.

There you have it. That's my typical day.

 We live in a fallen world and sin has distorted our perception of truth. Homosexuality is only one symptom of fallen humanity. In our brokenness of human nature, we have an undeniable inner craving to be whole. And yet, maybe it's because of our sinful nature that we (homosexuals and heterosexuals) seek wholeness in the wrong areas. 
 
 Whether we're struggling with same-sex attractions, pornography, envy or lying, it's easy to want to slap a label of "normal" or "healthy" on ourselves to try to justify our sinful behaviors. But a label will never cover the deep wounds of people entangled in a life that is displeasing to God.
JustineCredible

We live in a fallen world and sin has distorted our perception of truth. Homosexuality is only one symptom of fallen humanity. In our brokenness of human nature, we have an undeniable inner craving to be whole. And yet, maybe it's because of our sinful nature that we (homosexuals and heterosexuals) seek wholeness in the wrong areas. 
 
 Whether we're struggling with same-sex attractions, pornography, envy or lying, it's easy to want to slap a label of "normal" or "healthy" on ourselves to try to justify our sinful behaviors. But a label will never cover the deep wounds of people entangled in a life that is displeasing to God.

 
 Did you ever stop to think that maybe it's moreover the rampent consumerism which drives us as a people (all humans) to too much work for too little gain and not enough time with our kids?
 Because those are my major concerns. 
 
 I don't "struggle with" my sexuality as you would have hoped, let alone as much as I did BEFORE accepting who I am. It's you who is struggling with MY Sexuality.
 The fact that you or anyone else is so concerned troubles me. But not to the point where it takes over my life or makes me forget where my priorities lie.
 
 My family and their well being is, as it has always been, at the top of my priorities list. My having true equality, not dehumanizing descrimination, is part of that goal. Securing my equality equates to a better future for myself as well as my family. My child included. 
 
 So pray for my soul while I continue my fight to secure the futures of my family and those like ours. Because I won't stop until it has become reality.
joebrummer

But a label will never cover the deep wounds of people entangled in a life that is displeasing to God.

 
 
 Jaaman, Why do you assume that anyone is "struggling" with same sex attractions? I am not struggling at all!
Ladywolf

Whether we're struggling with same-sex attractions, pornography, envy or lying, it's easy to want to slap a label of "normal" or "healthy" on ourselves to try to justify our sinful behaviors. But a label will never cover the deep wounds of people entangled in a life that is displeasing to God.

 
 Jaaaman, I'm sorry that you are having to struggle with people who have same-sex attractions. I know that you have put a lot of energy into it as I've seen from your posts. It's very noble of you to worry as you claim not to have same-sex attractions yourself. Perhaps it's wisest to realize, you really don't have power over others and it's best to focus on enriching one's own life and allow others to develop without interference.
 
 I know that labels will never cover up the deep wounds of people entagled in a life that is displeasing to God, but if you really try hard to break free and find like-minded supportive people, I believe some healing can occur.
 
 Good luck to you.
montalban

We live in a fallen world and sin has distorted our perception of truth. Homosexuality is only one symptom of fallen humanity. In our brokenness of human nature, we have an undeniable inner craving to be whole. And yet, maybe it?s because of our sinful nature that we (homosexuals and heterosexuals) seek wholeness in the wrong areas. 
 
 Whether we?re struggling with same-sex attractions, pornography, envy or lying, it?s easy to want to slap a label of ?normal? or ?healthy? on ourselves to try to justify our sinful behaviors. But a label will never cover the deep wounds of people entangled in a life that is displeasing to God.

 Some people here have pride in their sins, or that they are misguided about their sin. It is a duty to point out these errors, without condemnation. I don't have the patience really, to do this, so I wish you the best and pray that you persevere.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  A day in the life, of your average sexual devient...
